resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction.)
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150-300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavored syrup can be added.

A smooth and creamy drink made with finely ground Japanese green tea powder (matcha) whisked with hot water, then blended with steamed milk. It has a vibrant green color, a slightly grassy and earthy taste, and a gentle natural sweetness. Often enjoyed with latte art or a dusting of matcha on top.

An espresso-based coffee drink made by pouring a shot (or double shot) of espresso over hot water. This method preserves the crema (the golden foam on top of espresso), giving it a strong, bold flavor but slightly less intensity than a straight espresso. Common in Australia and New Zealand.
